name: Greek Hamburgers
author: Cathy Gauthier
summary: I was craving some Greek food one night, but was also interested in a cheeseburger. I had some Mediterranean-esque ingredients in my fridge. Thankfully, the burgers came out AMAZING! Every person that has had the burgers though they were amazing, too. Enjoy! Serve with yogurt sauce, toasted hamburger buns, lettuce, and tomato. Try also with ground lamb.
directions: Mix ground beef, feta cheese, goat cheese, 2 tablespoons lemon juice, olive oil, oregano, and garlic together in a large bowl using your hands
Stir Greek yogurt, cucumber, and 3 tablespoons lemon juice together in a bowl
Heat a frying pan over medium heat for about 2 minutes; cook burgers to desired degree of doneness, about 5 minutes per side
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 160 degrees F (70 degrees C)
